definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: GDP growth rate is calculated at comparable prices.
sentences.chinese: 国内生产总值增长速度按可比价格计算。

sentences.english: Data in this table are calculated at constant pieces.
In early trading in Tokyo, the dollar fell sharply against the yen.
sentences.chinese: 在东京市场早市开盘时，美元对日元的比价急剧下跌。

sentences.english: Data in this table are calculated at constant prices.
sentences.chinese: 本表数据按可比价格计算。

sentences.english: Growth rates for Gross Domestic Product are calculated at comparable prices.
sentences.chinese: 国内生产总值增长速度按可比价格计算。

sentences.english: The ratio of grain and cotton price plays an important role for influencing farms to choose planting cotton.
sentences.chinese: 粮棉比价是影响农户植棉积极性的重要因素。

sentences.english: The growth rates of GDP are calculated at comparable prices. The same as in the following tables.
sentences.chinese: 国内生产总值增长速度按可比价格计算，下表同。

sentences.english: We also openly encourage our customers to shop around via our comparison links.
sentences.chinese: 我们还公开鼓励客户通过我们的比价链接货比三家。

sentences.english: Yes. You should do comparison shopping when you buy big-ticket items.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，买贵重东西时要先比价再买。

definition: merchandise or commodities available immediately after sale/merchandise in stock/available item/actuals (investment)/actual commodities
to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
to set a price/to fix a price
group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
